title: (x) Technical sans for Cartagena power plant - Alstom Sans {Adriano (self)}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222439im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/CARTAGENA_4111.jpg)

It’s a “klavikla/stainless flavored” more condensed typeface, anyone recognizes? That “y” rings a bell but no luck so far.

thanks  
a

 [‹ (x) Similar to Century Gothic - ITC Avant Garde Gothic {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222439/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36734 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Squarish sans copy on Tind packaging - Foundry Gridnik {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222439/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36750 "Go to next forum topic")
author: adriano

comments.content: I thought I recognized [PTL Notes](http://web.archive.org/) in there, but no. :^/
Yep, it does has a Ole Schäfer vibe... but no FF Fago or FF Tumino or FF Unit are a match.

Found it! It’s Alstom Sans from design agency Seenk @ Paris. From Christophe Badani & Stéphane Gabrielli | 2007. Very nice.

[Check here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222439/http:/www.typophage.com/en/fontes-exclusives/view/alstom-2)
